body.name: SAMSUNG 32" M50C Series FHD Smart Monitor w/Streaming-TV, 4ms, 60Hz, HDMI, HDR10, Watch Netflix, YouTube and More, IoT Hub, Mobile Connectivity, LS32CM501ENXZA, White
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Electronicity USA.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 4 hrs 16 mins
features: WATCH, PLAY, LIVE IN STYLE: Everything you need is right in your screen - all without connecting a separate PC - with the Smart Monitor; Your favorite content, productivity and video call apps are built in for a simpler and more stylish desktop setup

SMART TV EXPERIENCE: Enjoy Netflix, YouTube and other streaming services by simply connecting the monitor to WiFi; Samsung TV Plus also offers free live and on-demand content with no downloads or sign-up needed, while Universal Guide provides personalized content recommendations

PC-LESS PRODUCTIVITY: Browse the web, edit documents and work on projects, all without the need for a separate PC; With new Workmode, you can also remotely access another PC, use Microsoft 365 programs and even connect to Samsung mobile devices with Samsung DeX for seamless working

SLIMFIT CAMERA: The SlimFit camera with tilt functionality allows you to create the perfect angle while using your favorite video call apps like Google Duo, which can be accessed directly through the monitor; Plus, the camera cover and option to fully detach always protect your privacy

IoT HUB: Turn your Smart Monitor into a control center for the home by connecting it to your IoT home products with SmartThings; Turn off lights, pull down blinds and set the thermostat to the perfect temperature all with the Smart Monitor for a perfectly relaxed evening
body.description: `App availability varies by country, with possible subscriptions. Internet connection required; TV tuner not included. Samsung TV Plus and universal guide availability varies. Remote control specs differ by country. Full access to smart features, apps, and smart home functionality requires a Samsung account. Without it, only terrestrial TV and HDMI devices work. Some apps may lack keyboard and mouse support. UI subject to change. Terms and Conditions apply. 4K availability varies based on content subscription and internet connection. US-only gaming hub; some games need separate controller. On-screen content simulated for demo. Microsoft 365 requires Microsoft account. Wireless DeX on Selected Galaxy, Note and Tab devices, with Win 10 Pro, macOS 10.14.5+, and compatible work. Slimfit camera with Samsung DeX needs USB-C on Galaxy S23 from July 2023+. Camera accessory sold separately. Airplay or mobile mirroring needs iOS 12.3+, macOS 10.14.5+, or Android 8.0+. Varies by model’s area. Tech/features vary by country, service provider, network, product; subject to change. Requires Wi-Fi, Bluetooth or other wireless connection, SmartThings App devices. Separate SmartThings dongle for Zigbee/ Thread (Z-wave not supported.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love the free channels and excellent picture
reviews.reviewText: I got this TV/monitor to replace another 32” Samsung TV. My original TV was one of the first smart TV’s and I enjoyed it for year but I wanted the newer Samsung programming. I love that Samsung gives you so many free TV channels.This was really easy to set up as a monitor for my laptop as well. I am looking forward to working from home on my laptop and being able to use this as my display.The price was really fair for this. I know there are 50” TV’s in the same price range however they don’t have the same features as the Samsung.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like this tv, (computer monitor). I bought it as a computer monitor, it worked great but was too large, so I mounted it on the wall and use it as a TV, works great!Pros:- Wireless monitor capabilities- HDMI- Good picture quality- Easy to useCons:- It was great, no cons!I recommend this product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Jack of all trades master of some
reviews.reviewText: It's decent as a work monitor and as a streaming device. I use it for airbnb so guests can both get work done or watch streaming services. I would only use Airplay (wireless Mac screen extension) in case of emergency because that picture quality is bad and mouse moves very slow. Maybe a regular monitor with a Firestick connected would have fulfilled my needs (work monitor/streaming device/built in speaker) but I wasn't sure if remote volume control would work. All in all I think it was worth 279 for these needs. Also, I'm not sure how well it works with remote windows connection (no physical pc present) but if that's a thing you want to do and assuming it works well then I think there's no question this is good value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Did some searching for a tv to go in the bedroom and this was a great choice for the price range! The image is clear and bright!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good small TV
reviews.reviewText: Easy to set up, great picture, smart TV apps

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars It's...Cheap and it Works. Edit: Nope
reviews.reviewText: Well, I've had it for a few weeks now, and I regret buying it more by the day.The picture is BAD, both as a TV and as a computer monitor. It's so bad at light-to-dark transitions that simple scene changes look like there are ambulances flashing lights in the background.And the menus are bad. You can't hide stuff you don't use, like Samsung TV. You can't organize all the stuff you use on one screen.And worst of all, it shows advertisements! There is no way to turn them off. I paid for this TV, but I have to look at ads. Samsung's response to customer complaints is to call ads a "more enriching experience". !I stopped using Samsung phones a few years ago because of low quality and endless junk apps and ads. I guess I won't be buying anything else from them either.Original ReviewWell, it was cheap and it does work as both a TV and a monitor.It's not great at either. It has terrible ghosting issues -- if parts of the screen change from light to dark too quickly it leaves a white space like a negative for a split second. It's not too bad on TV, but it's really bad while playing video games. Everything looks like it has a magic spell cast on it.The tv is okay. Ghosting issues and bad Soap Opera Effect, but I figured out how to turn that down.The menus are awkward and clearly not designed for my convenience. The remote was okay once I figured out how to use it: no clear instructions and if you accidentally press the volume button it takes you off to wonderland.I don't regret my purchase, but next time I'll spend a little more money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Mixed Review: Samsung Monitor - Decent Display, Frustrating Remote Control Experience
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased a Samsung Monitor, and my overall experience with it has been a mixed bag. While the display quality is satisfactory, the remote control functionality has been a significant disappointment. Operating the monitor with the remote control requires a great deal of patience, as it is not very user-friendly.Let's start with the positive aspect—the display. The monitor boasts a decent display quality, delivering clear and vibrant visuals. Whether for work or entertainment purposes, the display meets the basic expectations of a modern monitor.However, when it comes to the remote control experience, the monitor falls short. Navigating through the menu and adjusting settings with the remote control can be a frustrating task. The remote control interface is not intuitive, and it often requires multiple attempts to successfully navigate and make changes. This lack of user-friendliness can be a significant drawback for those seeking a hassle-free experience.One notable aspect of the Samsung Monitor is its range of features. It offers a variety of options and settings to enhance the viewing experience. However, these features come with a downside—the monitor's overall performance suffers due to its slow response times. Actions such as switching between inputs or adjusting settings can be sluggish, resulting in a less than optimal user experience.While the monitor provides multiple features, it falls short of perfection. The slow response times and cumbersome remote control navigation detract from its potential. As a user, I expected a smoother and more efficient performance.In conclusion, the Samsung Monitor offers a satisfactory display quality, but its remote control experience is a major letdown. Navigating the menu and adjusting settings can be frustrating and time-consuming. Additionally, the monitor's performance suffers from slow response times, compromising its overall usability. If you prioritize a user-friendly interface and swift performance, this monitor may not be the ideal choice. Consider exploring alternative options that offer a more seamless and efficient experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Great quality of image and very chic look
Me gusta el tamaño, es muy práctico.

Estéticamente es un producto hermoso, la instalación sencilla y al principio cuando la conectas tardaras unos 15 min en descargar la actualización del sistema.El problema fue encontrar 5 pixeles muertos en la esquina superior derecha del monitor, aun así decidí darle la oportunidad de probarlo bien, cuando quieres jugar o ver películas es un suplicio cuando la escena es oscura porque presenta imagen lenta y fantasma con las cosas mas iluminadas de una imagen oscura. Las app van bien pero con lentitud, el sonido es bueno a secas. Lamentablemente 48hrs despues de la compra tuve que regresarlo, como dije antes una genial idea muy mal ejecutada.

reviews.reviewerName: Francisco Javier Otero SanchezFrancisco Javier Otero Sanchez
reviews.reviewText: Al principio funcionó bien. Pero con elpaso de los días, se fueron dañando los pixeles; hasta que la imagen se vio completamente distorsionada. Adjunto fotos de lo anterior como evidencia.

As someone else reviewed, this is a tv that tries to pass itself off as a monitor. I have many gripes with it, and was going to keep it, until it started flashing on and off by itself (three times while I was sharing my screen during a teams meeting). Why on earth does this thing turn itself off?Other issues:- sometimes won't even turn on- if you lose the remote it is useless. There are no buttons to turn it on and off or navigate- you need the remote to make it work because it goes to a screen with the 'smart monitor' options and from there you choose to cast your computerEven with caveat that I won't be able to use the remote, I was going to keep it. It sucks, but the speakers are decent, and the idea of having a smart monitor was appealing because you don't even need your computer to access Office 365. You can do it directly from the smart monitor. Where it lost me was it not turning on and today, turning off and on by itself during a teams meeting. It is absolutely the most frustrating thing.You want something that functions like a basic monitor. The add ons can be great, but it should still function like a basic easy to use monitor. This doesn't do that.Worst of all, it doesn't have any buttons, so if you lose the remote, good luck.Also the layout of the remote sucks. Who decided angling a left right button up or down would be a good idea for a volume or up navigation.This is good in theory but executed very very poorly.
